name: intermediacy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of carrying messages or making connections between people or things that are unwilling or unable to meet: Retailers occupy a position of intermediacy between manufacturers and consumers.through the intermediacy of The arms and legs are controlled by the brain through the intermediacy of the nervous system.
More examplesFewer examplesThey had no direct access to the market and could only operate through the intermediacy of other merchants.The governor would collect the taxes through the intermediacy of a local agent.Trading relations with the islands were maintained through the intermediacy of a few local chieftains.
